metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11097 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In FreeRDP before version 2.1.2, an out of bounds read occurs resulting in accessing a memory location that is outside of the boundaries of the static array PRIMARY_DRAWING_ORDER_FIELD_BYTES. This is fixed in version 2.1.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-11097` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-1
freerdp2-wayland - 2.2.0+dfsg1-1
freerdp2-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-1
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-1
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-1
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-1
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-1
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-1
libuwac0-0 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-1
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-1
libwinpr2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-1
winpr-utils - 2.2.0+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> The freerdp package in Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.04 LTS does not build a server library. This is simply a client denial of service that has a negligible security impact.

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.0+dfsg1-1').
